result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Van Der Molen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor >$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$10,000], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sell Securities w/ Scheme to Defraud

supervisions.notes: **11/11/2014 - JOC amended to reflect 12/31/1945 as date of birth for defendant.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay restitution and surcharge in an amount to be determined.  Court will issue written determination of restitution.

****2/6/2015 - JOC amended per hearing held January 30, 2015 to reflect restitution and restitution surcharge.  Restitution is as follows:  $183,370.51 to A. and L. G. and $124,195.00 to A. and D. C.  Restitution surcharge is 10% of total restitution or $30,756.55.

Defendant ordered to pay a minimum of $1,000.00 monthly toward restitution.

*****12/2/2015 - JOC amended to reflect that effective January 1, 2016, Defendant is ordered to pay $2,500.00 per month toward restitution.

****2/6/2015 - JOC amended per hearing held January 30, 2015 to reflect the following:
Defendant may not directly sell investments.  He may not be indirectly involved in sale of investments including not assisting others in selling investments and not supervising or managing others actively selling investments as part of the business defendant is managing or supervising for them.  However, he may assist in marketing to encourage individuals to rent such things as campsites or cabins in a campground or similar setting.

If Defendant pays the restitution ordered and complies with probation, he may be released from probation as early as 3 years.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - To be imposed by the Court as it sees fit.
